intro: Sida yunnanensis var. longistyla, commonly known as the Yunnan sida, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It is often found in moist, shady environments such as mountain forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
